TopicTitle: Which one looks nicer; new Mk1 cockpit or old one

Articles.Content:
I like the new one a lot better.

Now they need to redo that fugly inline cockpit (again).

Really? I like the new (post 1.0.3, 1.0-1.0.2 sucked) one a lot, it reminds me of a modern fighter jet and looks great on sci fi ships where that is the kind of effect you want. What in particular don't you like about it?

Really? I like the new (post 1.0.3, 1.0-1.0.2 sucked) one a lot, it reminds me of a modern fighter jet and looks great on sci fi ships where that is the kind of effect you want. What in particular don't you like about it?

Exactly this. The new inline cockpit is more than perfect for the jet/space fighters. It's good to see we're finally getting a civilian looking cockpit.

Also glad there are so many votes for the new cockpit. The old one is reallt ugly and not worth keeping, unless it got remodelles to look like X-1's cockpit or Arado 234's.

Exactly this. The new inline cockpit is more than perfect for the jet/space fighters. It's good to see we're finally getting a civilian looking cockpit.

Also glad there are so many votes for the new cockpit. The old one is reallt ugly and not worth keeping, unless it got remodelles to look like X-1's cockpit or Arado 234's.

yeah, the old one sucked, but it was good as a sort of x-plane type cockpit, which is a niche that will be unfilled if it's replaced with the new one as shown in the imgur album.

Really? I like the new (post 1.0.3, 1.0-1.0.2 sucked) one a lot, it reminds me of a modern fighter jet and looks great on sci fi ships where that is the kind of effect you want. What in particular don't you like about it?

It just looks bulbous. I guess the fact that you can't see through the canopy is what bothers me most. The canopy is huge and it's just a blue blob. I wonder why we can't see through any of the canopies?

Same reason you can't see through an astronauts visor to protect the occupant from the harsh raw sunlight in orbit. Also mods that have added see through windows have shown us that that's not good computer resource wise to try to render a bunch of iva's and animated kerbal's at once.

Either way there is no pleasing people. People should be happy that a part is high quality but instead they complain about vain things like style. That's honestly what modding is for, but no you need squad to to keep that old piece of trash for your sandbox fighter jets and have it take ram that could have gone to more functionally needed parts or even new planets to visit. Some times I really wish the replica makers would lay off and let squad make this a fun game instead of just a fun sandbox.
I just think the bubble cockpit should be more bubbly, with greater visibility down and backwards than the current one.

use a mod and let squad make the game look good for the rest of us then

Delete it if you don't like it and let Squad provide us with variety of different-looking parts for our design choices. That's a ridiculous, pretentious, snub BS argument.

Honestly, if it weren't for the Hatch on the side, I wouldn't mind as much, as the over all shape isn't that different, the the feel of the cockpit is so completely different that it was rather shocking. I think most people who want to keep the older style would love a new retuxture to make it more similar to the Mk1 inline cockpit. I think it's the over all feel that people want to preserve.

as far as this whole, let a mod make a replacement for the lost cockpit, it's a rather fallacious argument. The new one is so different from the old, and it replaces instead of improves the on the old one (It's not even using the old IVA model), that loosing the old one is going to drastically change many existing ships (aesthetically and functionally with hatch placement.) that it does warrant the thought of including both. Besides why should a mod bring back a part that had existed and doesn't quite exist in spiritual form in the later updates? It's not like the old Mk3 to new Mk3, as both were clearly designed to be space shuttle cockpits (but the latter one is a proper spiritual successor)
